properties.name: S3Bucket
properties.description: An Amazon S3 bucket in the same AWS Region as your function. The bucket can be in a different AWS account.

type.description: An Amazon S3 bucket in the same AWS Region as your function. The bucket can be in a different AWS account.

properties.name: S3Key
properties.description: The Amazon S3 key of the deployment package.

type.description: The Amazon S3 key of the deployment package.

properties.name: S3ObjectVersion
properties.description: For versioned objects, the version of the deployment package object to use.

type.description: For versioned objects, the version of the deployment package object to use.

properties.name: ZipFile
properties.description: The source code of your Lambda function. If you include your function source inline with this parameter, AWS CloudFormation places it in a file named index and zips it to create a deployment package..

type.description: The source code of your Lambda function. If you include your function source inline with this parameter, AWS CloudFormation places it in a file named index and zips it to create a deployment package..

DeadLetterConfig.description: The dead-letter queue for failed asynchronous invocations.

properties.name: TargetArn
properties.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Amazon SQS queue or Amazon SNS topic.

type.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Amazon SQS queue or Amazon SNS topic.

properties.name: Variables
properties.description: Environment variable key-value pairs.

type.description: Environment variable key-value pairs.

properties.name: Size
properties.description: The amount of ephemeral storage that your function has access to.

type.description: The amount of ephemeral storage that your function has access to.

properties.name: Arn
properties.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon EFS access point that provides access to the file system.

type.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon EFS access point that provides access to the file system.

properties.name: LocalMountPath
properties.description: The path where the function can access the file system, starting with /mnt/.

type.description: The path where the function can access the file system, starting with /mnt/.

properties.name: Command
properties.description: Command.

type.description: Command.

properties.description: EntryPoint.

type.description: EntryPoint.

properties.description: WorkingDirectory.

type.description: WorkingDirectory.

properties.name: ApplicationLogLevel
properties.description: Application log granularity level, can only be used when LogFormat is set to JSON

type.description: Application log granularity level, can only be used when LogFormat is set to JSON

properties.name: LogFormat
properties.description: Log delivery format for the lambda function

type.description: Log delivery format for the lambda function

properties.name: LogGroup
properties.description: The log group name.

type.description: The log group name.

properties.name: SystemLogLevel
properties.description: System log granularity level, can only be used when LogFormat is set to JSON

type.description: System log granularity level, can only be used when LogFormat is set to JSON

properties.name: RuntimeVersionArn
properties.description: Unique identifier for a runtime version arn

type.description: Unique identifier for a runtime version arn

properties.description: Trigger for runtime update

SnapStart.description: The function's SnapStart setting. When set to PublishedVersions, Lambda creates a snapshot of the execution environment when you publish a function version.

properties.name: ApplyOn
properties.description: Applying SnapStart setting on function resource type.

type.description: Applying SnapStart setting on function resource type.

SnapStartResponse.description: The function's SnapStart Response. When set to PublishedVersions, Lambda creates a snapshot of the execution environment when you publish a function version.

properties.name: ApplyOn
properties.description: Applying SnapStart setting on function resource type.

type.description: Applying SnapStart setting on function resource type.

properties.name: OptimizationStatus
properties.description: Indicates whether SnapStart is activated for the specified function version.

type.description: Indicates whether SnapStart is activated for the specified function version.

properties.name: Key
properties.description: The key name of the tag. You can specify a value that is 1 to 128 Unicode characters in length and cannot be prefixed with aws:. You can use any of the following characters: the set of Unicode letters, digits, whitespace, _, ., /, =, +, and -.

type.description: The key name of the tag. You can specify a value that is 1 to 128 Unicode characters in length and cannot be prefixed with aws:. You can use any of the following characters: the set of Unicode letters, digits, whitespace, _, ., /, =, +, and -.

properties.name: Value
properties.description: The value for the tag. You can specify a value that is 0 to 256 Unicode characters in length and cannot be prefixed with aws:. You can use any of the following characters: the set of Unicode letters, digits, whitespace, _, ., /, =, +, and -.

type.description: The value for the tag. You can specify a value that is 0 to 256 Unicode characters in length and cannot be prefixed with aws:. You can use any of the following characters: the set of Unicode letters, digits, whitespace, _, ., /, =, +, and -.

TracingConfig.description: The function's AWS X-Ray tracing configuration. To sample and record incoming requests, set Mode to Active.

properties.name: Mode
properties.description: The tracing mode.

type.description: The tracing mode.

VpcConfig.description: The VPC security groups and subnets that are attached to a Lambda function. When you connect a function to a VPC, Lambda creates an elastic network interface for each combination of security group and subnet in the function's VPC configuration. The function can only access resources and the internet through that VPC.

properties.name: Ipv6AllowedForDualStack
properties.description: A boolean indicating whether IPv6 protocols will be allowed for dual stack subnets

type.description: A boolean indicating whether IPv6 protocols will be allowed for dual stack subnets

properties.name: SecurityGroupIds
properties.description: A list of VPC security groups IDs.

type.description: A list of VPC security groups IDs.

properties.name: SubnetIds
properties.description: A list of VPC subnet IDs.

type.description: A list of VPC subnet IDs.

resource.description: Resource Type definition for AWS::Lambda::Function in region

properties.name: Code
properties.description: The code for the function.

type.description: The code for the function.

properties.name: CodeSigningConfigArn
properties.description: A unique Arn for CodeSigningConfig resource

type.description: A unique Arn for CodeSigningConfig resource

properties.name: DeadLetterConfig
properties.description: A dead letter queue configuration that specifies the queue or topic where Lambda sends asynchronous events when they fail processing.

type.description: A dead letter queue configuration that specifies the queue or topic where Lambda sends asynchronous events when they fail processing.

properties.name: Description
properties.description: A description of the function.

type.description: A description of the function.

properties.name: Environment
properties.description: Environment variables that are accessible from function code during execution.

type.description: Environment variables that are accessible from function code during execution.

properties.name: EphemeralStorage
properties.description: A function's ephemeral storage settings.

type.description: A function's ephemeral storage settings.

properties.name: FileSystemConfigs
properties.description: Connection settings for an Amazon EFS file system. To connect a function to a file system, a mount target must be available in every Availability Zone that your function connects to. If your template contains an AWS::EFS::MountTarget resource, you must also specify a DependsOn attribute to ensure that the mount target is created or updated before the function.

type.description: Connection settings for an Amazon EFS file system. To connect a function to a file system, a mount target must be available in every Availability Zone that your function connects to. If your template contains an AWS::EFS::MountTarget resource, you must also specify a DependsOn attribute to ensure that the mount target is created or updated before the function.

properties.name: FunctionName
properties.description: The name of the Lambda function, up to 64 characters in length. If you don't specify a name, AWS CloudFormation generates one.

type.description: The name of the Lambda function, up to 64 characters in length. If you don't specify a name, AWS CloudFormation generates one.

properties.name: Handler
properties.description: The name of the method within your code that Lambda calls to execute your function. The format includes the file name. It can also include namespaces and other qualifiers, depending on the runtime

type.description: The name of the method within your code that Lambda calls to execute your function. The format includes the file name. It can also include namespaces and other qualifiers, depending on the runtime

properties.name: ImageConfig
properties.description: ImageConfig

type.description: ImageConfig

properties.name: KmsKeyArn
properties.description: The ARN of the AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) key that's used to encrypt your function's environment variables. If it's not provided, AWS Lambda uses a default service key.

type.description: The ARN of the AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) key that's used to encrypt your function's environment variables. If it's not provided, AWS Lambda uses a default service key.

properties.name: Layers
properties.description: A list of function layers to add to the function's execution environment. Specify each layer by its ARN, including the version.

type.description: A list of function layers to add to the function's execution environment. Specify each layer by its ARN, including the version.

properties.name: LoggingConfig
properties.description: The logging configuration of your function

type.description: The logging configuration of your function

properties.name: MemorySize
properties.description: The amount of memory that your function has access to. Increasing the function's memory also increases its CPU allocation. The default value is 128 MB. The value must be a multiple of 64 MB.

type.description: The amount of memory that your function has access to. Increasing the function's memory also increases its CPU allocation. The default value is 128 MB. The value must be a multiple of 64 MB.

properties.name: PackageType
properties.description: PackageType.

type.description: PackageType.

properties.name: Policy
properties.description: The resource policy of your function

type.description: The resource policy of your function

properties.name: ReservedConcurrentExecutions
properties.description: The number of simultaneous executions to reserve for the function.

type.description: The number of simultaneous executions to reserve for the function.

properties.name: Role
properties.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the function's execution role.

type.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the function's execution role.

properties.name: Runtime
properties.description: The identifier of the function's runtime.

type.description: The identifier of the function's runtime.

properties.name: RuntimeManagementConfig
properties.description: RuntimeManagementConfig

type.description: RuntimeManagementConfig

properties.name: SnapStart
properties.description: The SnapStart setting of your function

type.description: The SnapStart setting of your function

properties.name: Tags
properties.description: A list of tags to apply to the function.

type.description: A list of tags to apply to the function.

properties.name: Timeout
properties.description: The amount of time that Lambda allows a function to run before stopping it. The default is 3 seconds. The maximum allowed value is 900 seconds.

type.description: The amount of time that Lambda allows a function to run before stopping it. The default is 3 seconds. The maximum allowed value is 900 seconds.

properties.name: TracingConfig
properties.description: Set Mode to Active to sample and trace a subset of incoming requests with AWS X-Ray.

type.description: Set Mode to Active to sample and trace a subset of incoming requests with AWS X-Ray.

properties.name: VpcConfig
properties.description: For network connectivity to AWS resources in a VPC, specify a list of security groups and subnets in the VPC.

type.description: For network connectivity to AWS resources in a VPC, specify a list of security groups and subnets in the VPC.
